name: IGo Pasta
address: Calle de Dolores Barranco, 88, 28026 Madrid, Spain
review:
We've been in Spain for a week now. We were kind of tired of eating tapas so we want some hot soups. Went to have some ramen noodles because I was feeling a.... This place had pros and cons:

Pros: 
Great food. I really enjoyed the noodles! It had the kind of chewy noodle that I really like and the soup was good.... I had a chicken teriyaki ramen there, and to be honest, it's totally different from what normal people think it would be. The broth was made by soy sauce....

name: Los Porfiados
review: Wow. Don't let the hipster decor fool you. There are some serious eats in this place. Reserve ahead as it gets full around Spanish dinner time, that is to.... Awesome.  Called ahead bc yelp said no credit card but I quickly realized when asking about "tarjetas de credito" that he spoke English and they definitely.... Great freakin food and we met the owner while eating and he was great! Quaint little spot with amazing tapas for cheap. The quality for the price is what....

name: Royal Cantonés
review: Great Chinese restaurant in Madrid! Madrid is an amazing town for travel, but I'm still craving for Chinese food somehow. Found this restaurant in Madrid.... I decided to give it a try after the positive reviews in Yelp, and it turned out to be a great gastronomic experience. We ordered several dishes to share,.... It was already. It was nice seeing canto food on a menu in Madrid after being away from home for so long. I got the porridge and the siu mai. Porridge was....

name: MartinaCocina
review:
The staff is really amazing. Everybody is committed to make you feel at home. 

The quality of the food is good. Fresh ingredients and very good taste..... Awesome food and terrific service. We went for breakfast and loved the avocado toast and eggs. Beautiful patio too.. I'm so happy this cafe was so close to the Airbnb! It's extremely cute, with a nice vibe. We really enjoyed the music they played, including a Spanish....

name: Cafelito
review:
This joint was near the AirBnb but I walked back here EVERY morning of my seven day trip!  Smallish cafe with counter in front and tables in the back, you.... Amazing place, wonderful people and very tasty food
I totally recommend if you want to spend in very energized and super friendly atmosphere.. Excellent coffee. Excellent staff. We visited twice while lodging nearby in Madrid. It's a quiet place with a great vibe..

name: Donde da la Vuelta el Viento
address: Calle de Mesón de Paredes, 81, 28012 Madrid, Spain
review: Great place with friendly staff. I came for take away and they only had a menu in Spanish, but the man who served me translated the entire menu for me line.... Great place, super friendly, good prices, quality food. I forgot my Hat, they chased me down the street to give it back. Gracias Bonita, nice lady serving.... Awsome place, we came late but they still welcomed us really  well. We ordered the chicken meatballs, the salad, and the hummus and everything tasted....

name: Tribuetxe
review: I used to live across the street from Tribuetxe and always wanted to try it; I just never found the right time to pop in! Finally, after visiting the.... The best food we had in Madrid hands down, and that's saying something for a city with so much deliciousness to offer. I'm almost reluctant to review this.... We wanted our last meal in Spain to be tapas. Despite the incredible noise of this tiny bar, we decided to stick it out and order a few things... scrambled....

name: Más Al Sur
address: Calle de Santa Isabel, 35, 28012 Madrid, Spain
review: This is the very first stop we did in Madrid. And it could not have been more perfect. It was a few blocks from our hotel, and it's a very small and cozy.... Great tapas bar in the heart of Madrid. Our hotel staff recommended this as one of the best places for tapas in the city - it helped that it was just a few.... One night during our trip, we were looking around for the best paella and chanced upon this restaurant. We were immediately greeted and seated by the....

name: Ôven
review:
Great for Americans!  
Our waiter spoke some English and they had English menus for our Oklahoman selves.

I had the shrimp linguini and the hubby had the.... The pizza was undercooked and the service was sparse, but overall it was OK. Probably wouldn't come back.. Service a 0, food between 2-3 stars. My son got the pepperoni pizza which was probably the best of what we ordered. I had lasagna that came out like warm....

name: Corazón Agavero Mezcaloteca
review: Great place for cocktails if you're visiting Madrid. We loved the food, drinks and overall atmosphere. Bartender that night were very knowledgeable and very.... Amazing bar that specializes in mezcal! The food was delicious & the drinks were amazing. The bartender was extremely detailed and amazing! Definitely stop.... These fools know how to make a michelada, that is for sure. Their cocktail game in general is solid. Feeling chingon? They got a tequila and mezcal....

name: El Valle
address: Calle de Sebastián Herrera, 6, 28012 Madrid, Spain
review:
The size of everything you order at this restaurant is epic in size!

If you're looking for a tasty place to eat near the theaters in the area this is the.... We were walking by and noticed this place was playing the USA - Belgium match on the flatscreen, and so the three of us ducked inside. We were charmed....

name: O Pazo de Lugo
review:
I was lucky enough to stumble onto this place during a recent trip.  Madrid is a beautiful city with many local bars with great tapas.  This stands out..... Service was great. We showed up without a reservation but were able to get seats within 5 minutes despite it being packed. Order drinks and the bartender.... Stopped by for lunch and loved every second of it...

Croquettas were amazing, some of the best we've ever had...  Great, great mini hamburguesas that are....

name: Boconó
review:
The ambiance is very low-key/understated. When I first walked up I didn't see it immediately; but, once I did, the thing that stood out for me was the fact.... Great place for specialty coffee. Cappuccino had a light flavor to it so not bold as I like it but still happy that I found a coffee place that had oat.... Pleasant atmosphere. Good service. 
Great food and coffee. 
Highly recommended. Cheers!.

name: Don Giovanni
address: Paseo de la Reina Cristina, 23, 28014 Madrid, Spain
review:
Honestly have had better Italian food at the worst Italian places in the middle of nowhere America. 


The service was meh--asked for a beer and never.... My husband and I were so excited about the delicious food that I didn't take pictures.  The Fantasia salad is a magical way to serve a salad--try it for.... We got the Carpaccio di bresaola, Tagliatelle al salmone and Tortelli Nicholas. Everything was delicious! Friendly and attentive staff. If you're in the....

name: Mis Tradiciones
address: Paseo de las Yeserías, 15, 28005 Madrid, Spain
review: Our best meal in Madrid! The baccalao (cod) was tender and delicious, though too salty. Refreshing gazpacho though it was a sneaky move to offer it as if it....

name: Malacatín
address: Calle de la Ruda, 5, 28005 Madrid, Spain
review: Low key and off a busy street, this place was a great experience. About a 21 minute walk from El Museo de Reina Sofia. It is a great spot to take a break.... I usually eat lunch early, so when I got to the restaurant at opening time (11:30am), of course, they did not have the the full cocido experience until 1pm..... Excellent food!  Had the Cocido soup...it was fabulous... this is a Madrid tradition. This restaurant has been open for 120 years family-owned. The wine was....

name: La Cevicuchería
review: We are visiting from the USA. This restaurant is by far one of the most exceptional restaurants!  The ceviche is fresh with a bounty of flavor. Our waitress.... Really good taste!! It is the best ceviche  I've ever eaten, although the quantity is low considering the price of the dish.. If you like ceviche and Peruvian food this place is a new hidden gem. Its been open now for 2 months and packed. The food quality is top, and decoration is....

name: El Rincón Asturiano
address: Calle de las Delicias, 26, 28045 Madrid, Spain
review:
We are here for dinner again on two consecutive nights! The dinner and the service was excellent both times. 

We came here because the hotel desk person.... Excellent quality food , not expensive , great service 
Well worth the visit ........................... Our first stop in Madrid and the service was awful . Disappointed as the menu looked amazing. The waitress was extremely rude and she seemed bother when we....

name: Sani Sapori
description: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt Desserts Cafeteria
review:
The best ice cream 
I love it 
All made from fresh fruits very tasty flavor 
Very clean place. The gelato served here is AMAZING! You must try it to to really taste the delicious flavors. They make everything from organic and real ingredients, you can.... I'm afraid this will be my favorite ice cream parlor in Madrid. it's small and if you don't search good enough, you'd pass this place by, but amazing taste....

name: Buenas y Santas
review: I was here yesterday for lunch and the place, although small, is very good.  My order was a burger, but this was a burger made from chicken.  They tell you.... Restaurante argentino moderno y económico. Menú diario por debajo de 11€. La carta es rica (y apta para vegetarianos), la presentación es muy buena y la....

name: Steak Burger
review: Being American, we have very high expectations for ribs and burgers! But Steak Burger delivered!! The ribs were tasty (especially the sauce) and the fries.... This place was conveniently place right across the hotel so I decided to have dinner here. It's nothing fancy but definitely a great burger. Staff is.... This place was very good for satisfying one's craving for American-style burgers. They have a nice menu of items to choose from and you can really tailor....

name: La Parrilla III
address: Calle de la Pilarica, 20, 28026 Madrid, Spain
review: Holy food coma! The food is really great especially the grilled sausages etc. We always come here every time we return to Madrid..

name: Bodegas Rosell
address: Calle del Gral. Lacy, 14, 28045 Madrid, Spain
review:
Stayed at Marriott AC Atocha for a few nights on the way to the Canaries.  Perfect dinner after a long trip flying in from the US. I wanted something close,.... Amazing place to eat! Loved all the variety. 
Service was great! Our waiver was warm and welcoming, made some jokes and took good care of us!. Excellent food, neighborhood restaurant.
Enjoyed the Spanish Omelette; the tomato and Brie salad was epic.
A small space, loud, but really relaxed and....

name: La Pequeña Graná
description: Tapas Bars Tapas/Small Plates Beer Bar
review: Delicious tapas with awesome service. We ordered several types of tapas and they were all delicious. Wonderful service by the staff. Highly recommend it.. I was staying nearby, and sadly only ventured here on my last night. This place is how broke Madrileños do it, napkins on the floor and all. If you sit.... Well, I'm eating at the bar now. The place is not gonna change your life, but the beer is good, and the tapas are good even if they are on the small side.....

name: La Tabacalera
review: Former Tobacco factory turned to a free of charge independent art venue with wide range of activities(from Argentinian tango to a prof. wrestling /shows,.... The gallery space is very nice and I have seen some lucha libre here in an adjacent space. Apparently there used to be some useful and informative workshops....

name: Ruda Café
address: Calle de la Ruda, 11, 28005 Madrid, Spain
review: Tiny tiny space, very cute, nice people, good food. Cortados on point. They were out of the yogurt, unfortunately, so we ordered a couple breakfast toasts.... Tiny little spot with not much room to sit but if there's a spot take it. Food and drinks were great. Charming little coffee shop playing Beatles tunes and serving delicious coffee and gourmet toast. Just a min away from the Sunday La Latina markets. Perfect....

name: Atocha Tandoori
address: Paseo de Santa Maria de la Cabeza, 27, 28045 Madrid, Spain
review: South Asian cuisine of Bangladesh influence. The papad with chutney sauces was less spiced and not as potent as the Indian cuisine options of which I am.... Amazing food for a great price! Chicken tandoori is deliciously spicy and satisfying! The biryani was also very very good. Highly recommend. I wish I could rate this place more than 5 stars. It was AMAZING! My partner and I had been in Spain for almost 10 days when we came here and let me just....

name: Shapla
review: Searched all day for some gut busting Indian food, and boy did we find it. The Boo is all about Indian grub, especially the frozen dinners she snatches up.... I usually like this place, but today I saw a rat in the bathroom and I'm never coming back.. After seven days of tapas, we needed a break. Spanish food is great but we were craving some variety. We chose this place based on the other Yelp reviews,....

name: Pui Thai Tapas
address: Calle de José Antonio de Armona, 7, 28012 Madrid, Spain
review:
A Legit Thai food from me (A Thai) just the items you see in the menu makes me excited right away! It looks like real Thai food from home! Everything taste.... Love, love, love our Thai tapas.  It's just what we needed after almost two weeks eating tapas and paella!  

We took the Metro from Sol which was an easy 3.... Like being back in Thailand and only dining at the best restaurants.  Pui's Thai offerings are fresh, authentic (with some updating -- even better) served....

name: Phuket Thai Restaurante Tailandes
review: My wife, no matter where we travel to in the world, after a few days of eating the traditional meals, she always has to turn back to asian food, ie:.... Food: I ordered a beer, some Spring Rolls, and the Pad Thai con Gambas. It was somewhat expensive and the portions were surprisingly small especially the.... When we walked in, we thought it felt like an Asian spa. It was dark and they were playing low soft music. You walk down a long hallway, pass the restroom....

name: Fratelli d'Italia
review: THIS PLACE WAS A LIFE SAVER!!!  After not really eating before our 2 1/2 hour train ride from Salamanca, I was looking for a MUCH better meal than what our.... Fratelli d'Italia serves some very reasonably priced, high quality pizza.  We visited a couple of times while we were in Madrid, and were impressed both by.... We returned to Madrid for a single night before our flight back to the U.S., both of us suffering from the tail end of nasty cases of food poisoning that....

name: Piscomar
address: Carrera de San Francisco, 15, 28005 Madrid, Spain
review:
LOVE this Peruvian restaurant! Everything was just perfect from the ambiance, to the friendly staff and amazing food. 
All the dished we had were a delight.... We went last night, it was very nice. Not crowded, calm, and very relaxing. Does not really cater to English speakers. We tried the fried yucca rounds, they.... The food and service was amazing, but it is upsetting that they don't respect what they offer to clients, I'm not the type of person ghat uses coupons or....

name: Go Hyang Mat
address: Calle del Divino Vallés, 31, 28045 Madrid, Spain
review: Visiting from LA area, family was craving for Korean food. Had chicken bbq, rice cake soup (to celebrate New Years), soon tofu soup, and sweet spicy squid,.... Definitely will go again someday. The Korean jefa speaks good Korean, Spanish and Chinese jaja. Food was fantastic. She stopped me ordering more food as I.... This restaurant is delicious!!! Just like the Korean food in Seattle! The black bean sauce with noodles is amazing! Can't wait to come back and try more!.

name: La Encantada
review: Inviting intimate environment, friendly staff, and good tapas. Some vegetarian options - the tzatziki was amazing and the Greek salad was fresh and....

name: Los Chuchis
review: Some of the best food I had in Spain was served in a British restaurant. Go figure! But we absolutely loved every bite we had here. The food is hearty and.... Had the slow cooked pork and it was amazing.  This place is small but has a big heart and the server was warm and welcoming.  Definitely will come back next.... A lot of friends and online reviews suggested Los Chuchis as a top restaurant in lavapies. We made a reservation on a Saturday night at 8:30pm, right before....

name: Yankenpon
review: Food was just okay. The sushi rolls were simple, but good. The udon noodles with pork contained very little pork belly, which was thinly sliced and not.... In the mood for some sushi after El Rastro, a good Yelp search lead me here! I walked by the Mercado de San Fernando a few times before realizing Yakenpon.... This place is okay but I will not repeat it again. It's not very Japanese authentic. Actually I was a bit disappointed because I saw some good reviews and....

name: Taberna La Andaluza
address: Calle de Antonio López, 239, 28041 Madrid, Spain

name: Swinton & Grant
review: My three stars go to the three times I've been here and had a lovely experience. It's a hipster cafe with cool books and decorations. I've always done.... This is a new business that has been open for about a month. I noticed it on my way home from work, and later that afternoon came back to check it out. The.... The place stopped serving as 'cafe' 2 years ago. I went there today and the staff gave me this info..

name: Egeo - Suvlakeria Griega
review:
This is without a doubt the best, and most authentic tasting Greek style gyro that I've had outside of Greece. I come from a Greek American family where we.... Food was fresh and delicious. I was with my daughter and her friends in Madrid. They wanted Greek food and this hit the spot! Definitely on their go-to list!. Note- I only had one thing here- the fries with feta cheese- so idk how helpful this review actually is. 
But anyways, we went in at around 6 and it was....

name: Pum Pum Café
review:
Great food with large portion. Really well prepared egg and croissant. Service guy was really helpful.. This cafe is so marvelous.
Beware though, it is loud due to the music.

Customer service was friendly and we were greeted immediately. The cafe is.... Came here as a recommendation from our AirBNB host for breakfast. Loved the ambience and our first real meal in Madrid. However, we did not know it was a....

name: Juan Raro
review:
Super nice and relaxing place. Excellent Food and service. We came 3 times in 3 days, so there it is. Nice owner Micky and great Ladies serving.
Best.... I decided to try this place out when I was asking by it and then later saw it had good reviews on Yelp. The rating did not lie - this place is cool. 

I got.... This was my absolute favorite dinner in Spain. Located in the artsy, bohemian neighborhood of Lavapiés, Juan Raro is part café, part tapas restaurant, part....

name: Javier Martín Croquetas & Café
review: I will never imagine all the variety's of croquetas, this is a typical Spaniard appetizer, you have to try it, 100% recommended.. Convenient shop with great service. The owner was the chef and waiter. Forgot the name but the omelet pictured is a must try!. This place is just amazing, i loved, i spend only 3 days in Madrid but ate 2 times here. The staff, the seating and everything was good..

name: Melo's
address: Calle del Ave María, 44, 28012 Madrid, Spain
review: This is a unique place. They have a short menu with basically croquetas, thick ham with melted tetilla cheese and pimientos de padrón. Everything is.... Looks like a mom and pa hole in the wall type of place. Introduced by my YouTube friends, this place is a must on your visit to Madrid. Also how does the.... During a holiday in Spain, I was recommended to give Melo's a try for a quick bite.  Late one night, my friend and I found ourselves here.  The restaurant....

name: La Encomienda
address: Calle de la Encomienda, 19, 28012 Madrid, Spain
review:
Another fantastic vegan spot in surprisingly vegan-friendly Madrid. We stopped her for a leisurely lunch and were impressed by everything we had.

We shared.... Very tasteful, surprising.
The cabbage cannelloni are a must.
Good selection of beers.. Lovely place, I want to steal a little rock they put on the table, but I don't 
Perfect space for vegan and vegetarian if you are looking for something....

name: Buen Gusto
address: Paseo de Santa María de la Cabeza, 60, 28045 Madrid, Spain
review: Would definitely recommend, staff was super friendly. Great selection of authentic chinese cuisine. Personally, really liked the zongzi- made in house- ,.... The food is tasty, and the menu extensive. For a person not versed in authentic  Chinese food there are some more typical dishes available. Everything I saw.... Authentic Chinese food in a residential area near the Atocha train station and Park Retiro. Price is high, but worth the money. Waiters and waitresses are....

name: Oliveto
review:
Very nice small restaurant and with good wine choice, and good price.

Tasteful food and good wine choice. Super racist place. They had empty tables but turned us down due to being racist pigs. Skip this place and go to La Burlona up the block because they're.... This restaurant is a gem. Authentic Italian at very reasonable prices. Highly recommend and would come back here on my next visit to Madrid..

name: Arzábal
address: Calle Santa Isabel, 52, Museo Reina Sofia, 28012 Madrid, Spain
review: Super cute restaurant tucked inside the Reina Sofía museum. When we first walked in, they asked if we wanted "lunch" or "snacks." We didn't realize we were.... I stopped a few times for a drink. Nice atmosphere.  Made a reservation for dinner. What a mistake. Everyone around us had drinks and ordered even though we.... Although the wait time to get my food was a bit longer than I wanted, this Cafe is still a nice place to go when visiting the Sofia museum. I started off my....

name: Kebapchi Jalo
address: Calle del Ave María, 39, 28012 Madrid, Spain
review: Good selection and great service.  I would go if I end up in Madrid again..

name: La Burbuja que Ríe
review:
Great cider, tapas and atmosphere.  Very reasonable prices. I am sad I found it my last day in Madrid! Service was great.. I want cider!!
What a great place! I loved the potatoes with cabrales cheese. Lively, noisy, brilliant. And oh, the cider....
